dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SALVATION IS AN OBJECT OF SUPREME VALUE

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: You also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house.

mapping_structuur.doel_element: The dwelling place of God's Spirit

cognitieve_implicaties: An isolated stone has no structural purpose.
Stones must be shaped/chiseled to fit.
theologische_implicaties: The Church is the primary locus of God's presence.
ethische_implicaties: Believers must commit to local church membership.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Loss of individual agency (stones are inanimate).

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'dead' metaphor of 'living stones' by emphasizing the physical pressure of being 'fitted together' (above, beside, below).

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the 'Cornerstone' as the bridge between the Architectural and Relational domains. The stone is not just a block; it is 'precious' and 'rejected,' personifying the architectural element.

succesvolle_blending.locatie: Point 3B: 'He has to be precious to you'
succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher uses a narrative parable (the expensive medicine) to explain the 'preciousness' of the 'stone,' shifting from structural utility to existential value.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-animates the 'temple' imagery by connecting it to the history of the shekinah glory.
sterktes.voorbeeld: At night it was like fire. In the daytime it looked like a cloud.

risicos.beschrijving: Framing the 'brokenness' of the world primarily through the lens of 'not being able to bear the presence' might minimize the legal/moral aspect of sin.
risicos.voorbeeld: When it broke the relationship with God, it actually also deeply broke us.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation views sin as a trauma to be healed rather than a rebellion to be repented of.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The Ancient Temple/Tabernacle (The Presence of God).
sub_worlds: The 'uttermost foundation' from Lord of the Rings

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates a sense of historical continuity.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Argues that individual change is impossible without being 'fitted' into the community.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Uses the 'Input/Output' biological metaphor to challenge passive attendance.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the 'Gathered People' theology of the liturgy.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in CMT. It takes a potentially 'dead' biblical metaphor (Living Stones) and uses embodied cognition (pressure, fitting, foundation) to make it psychologically urgent. The dominant landscape is architectural, but it is warmed by relational and economic sub-metaphors.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the 'Sacrifice' source domain by describing the physical cost of 'output' in a city like NYC.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The sacrifice of your time on a Tuesday night in the subway.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Emphasize that the 'Stone' is 'Living' because it shares the life of the 'Living Stone' (Jesus).

entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'Holy Nation' or 'Journey' metaphor to show the church's mission in the world.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To complement the 'Living Stone' idea with organic growth.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A brilliant use of conceptual mapping to move from abstract theology to concrete congregational participation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: CMT focuses on how 'Stone' functions as a cognitive anchor for identity, not just a pretty image.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential cycle, CMT shows how the metaphor itself structures the experience of the 'fitted' life.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the 'Cornerstone' is not just a title for Jesus, but a spatial orientation for the believer's entire life-world.

appendices.notities: The use of the Balrog/Gandalf illustration serves as a 'Schema Refresh' for the concept of 'Foundation'.
